DOC.brief_summary: Knowing effect proprioceptive exercise program improving balance , gait risk fall institutionalize elderly .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Exercise Proprioceptive Program Institutionalized Elderly
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study determine effect proprioceptive exercise program improve balance gait well reduce risk fall institutionalize elderly healthcare center . To evaluate effect , total 45 subject participate longitudinal control trial . Inclusion criteria 65 year olds , institutionalized center ability read write . Thereafter , participant separate two different group ( experimental control ) . Randomization perform use sealed envelope different number intervention inside . Both group evaluate start first session last working session . The control group perform geriatric revitalization program experimental group . Besides one , experimental group perform program proprioceptive exercise . The intervention rate 2 weekly session 12 week group ( 24 session ) , last 55 minute . The variable analyze : questionnaire risk fall hospital ( MORSE ) , Tinetti scale , test Timed Up Go ( TUG ) , time one leg , Cooper test run 12 minute scale Barthel . The study sample calculate use `` G-Power 3.1.2 '' program , statistical significance p < 0.05 , one study power 80 % ( 0.8 ) , two study group , effect size medium f = 0.25 . The data analysis perform use Statistical Package Social Sciences ( SPSS statistical software ) , version 19.0 Windows , Chicago . To determine normal distribution data Shapiro-Wilks test comparison ANOVA perform . The value obtain pretest posttest assessment variable compare Student test relate sample Wilcoxon rank test .
DOC.criteria: Being institutionalize , ability read write , access study voluntarily . Significant degree cognitive impairment ; intolerance moderate physical activity , cause cardiovascular respiratory disease , well complete 90 % session .
